* The entire floor area inside one sheltered unit is covered with fecal waste. Four Zebu and one Brahma steer are in
contact with the affected area located in an outdoor enclosure. Fecal waste can attract pests or rodents, become an area
of disease transmission or area of contamination to the animals. Odors, insects, disease hazards or pest infestation can
have an adverse effect on the health and well-being of the animals. Facility representative stated that the fecal waste was
removed in the summer on 2020. The licensee shall ensure that excreta shall be removed from primary enclosures as
often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize disease hazards and to
reduce odors. Correct by 1/30/21.

the facility representative.
